Prior to the passage of the ACA: members of Congress received healthcare insurance benefits through the Federal Employees Health Benefits Program (FEHBP), similar to other federal employees.
The ACA introduced a provision requiring: specifically the District of Columbia’s small business health options program (SHOP) exchange.
Members of Congress do not receive free: they purchase their insurance through the SHOP exchange and receive a subsidy equivalent to 72 percent of the weighted average of all FEHBP premiums.
